result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius D Macklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Demetrius D Macklin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Demetrius D Macklin was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Demetrius D Macklin was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Demetrius D Macklin was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.

No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
No possession of any firearms or ammunition.

Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.
Complete mental health assessment and treatment.
Take all prescribed medications. 
Comply with all rules of extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
Cooperate with agent.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Counts 1 and 4,
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Counts 1 and 3.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius D Macklin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Demetrius D Macklin.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-trial.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 4:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 120 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 218 DAYS time served; the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 60 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 60 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 120 MONTHS, concurrent with Counts 1 and 4; the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 60 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 60 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 4: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 120 MONTHS, concurrent with Counts 1 and 3; the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 60 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 60 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.
- DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
- Complete mental health assessment and treatment.
- Take all prescribed medications. 
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of extended supervision and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

The court VACATES the Jury Trial set for 9/19/2022.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Demetrius D Macklin not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court set filing deadlines for parties. State has until July 1st, 2022, to give a copy of the crime lab report to the defense. Defense has until August 19th, 2022, to file and change of plea forms. Parties have until September 2nd, 2022, to file any trial documents. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. Discussions put forth on the record in reference to amended information issues. Court proceeds with hearing. Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court further orders 03/28/2022 deadline for the exchange of discovery with the exception of crime lab reports, and 04/22/2022 deadline for filing motions and/ or filing plea forms. Case adjourned to Br 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Young. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Demetrius D Macklin in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius D Macklin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
